            "title": [
              ["If a header "],
              ["header.h", [["c"]]],
              [" needs a new nested header "],
              ["extra.h", [["c"]]],
              [", you do not have to check every source file that uses "],
              ["header.h", [["c"]]],
              [" to see whether you need to add "],
              ["extra.h", [["c"]]],
              ["."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "bulleted_list",
          "version": 1
        }

      "4f3864fb-bc04-4bb6-bdfd-8fbb49418574": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,

          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551937231334,
          "id": "4f3864fb-bc04-4bb6-bdfd-8fbb49418574",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551937231334,
          "parent_id": "1a09d20d-474b-455a-ab22-0926f14115d0",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "This standard requires a unit’s header to contain #include statements for all other headers required by the unit header. Placing #include for the unit header first in the unit body allows the compiler to verify that the header contains all required #include statements."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "quote",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "4fdd65b2-f425-48d0-988d-478432054097": {

          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Header files should not be nested. The prologue for a header file should, therefore, describe what other headers need to be #included for the header to be functional. In extreme cases, where a large number of header files are to be included in several different source files, it is acceptable to put all common #includes in one include file."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "quote",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "One advantage of the alternate design is that the #include list in the body file is exactly the dependency list needed in a makefile, and this list is checked by the compiler. With the standard design, a tool must be used to generate the dependency list. However, all of the branch recommended development environments provide such a tool."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",

          "alive": true,

          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551937231334,
          "id": "87bbe69f-e4e6-4bc4-823b-8a567d18155c",

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Another disadvantage of the alternate design is that compiler library header files, and other third party files, must be modified to add the required #ifdef statements."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",

        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551937231333,
          "id": "96ebe6ed-7dbf-4045-b4f1-d04a8d69ce5c",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551937231333,
          "parent_id": "1a09d20d-474b-455a-ab22-0926f14115d0",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["The "],
              [
                "NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC) coding standards for C",
                [
                  [
                    "a",
                    "http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1804486/should-i-use-include-in-headers"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " is one of the more modern standards — but is now a little hard to track down. It states that headers should be self-contained. It also provides a simple way to ensure that headers are self-contained: the implementation file for the header should include the header as the first header. If it is not self-contained, that code will not compile."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Modern headers should be self-contained, which means that a program that needs to use the facilities defined by "
              ],
              ["header.h", [["c"]]],
              [" can include that header ("],
              ["#include \"header.h\"", [["c"]]],
              [
                ") and not worry about whether other headers need to be included first."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1

      "eb274c38-d328-4149-b9a8-ea4ef5620fac": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",

          "created_by_table": "notion_user",

          "id": "eb274c38-d328-4149-b9a8-ea4ef5620fac",
          "ignore_block_count": true,

          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551937231334,
          "parent_id": "1a09d20d-474b-455a-ab22-0926f14115d0",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "A major disadvantage of the alternate design is that if a unit’s required header list changes, each file that uses that unit must be edited to update the #include statement list. Also, the required header list for a compiler library unit may be different on different targets."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "quote",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "f0012c2c-496a-45b6-967a-892d825e1ca6": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551937231334,
          "id": "f0012c2c-496a-45b6-967a-892d825e1ca6",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551937231334,
          "parent_id": "1a09d20d-474b-455a-ab22-0926f14115d0",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "An alternate design, not permitted by this standard, allows no #include statements in headers; all #includes are done in the body files. Unit header files then must contain #ifdef statements that check that the required headers are included in the proper order."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "quote",
          "version": 5
        }
      }
    },
    "space": {}
  }
}
